content:
If you're looking for an affordable wine to pair with your braunschweiger wrap, here are a few options that should pair well:

1. Beaujolais: This light, fruity red wine pairs well with charcuterie and is often affordable. Look for a Beaujolais Nouveau or a Beaujolais Villages for a budget-friendly option.
2. Pinot Noir: This red wine is another good option for pairing with charcuterie. Pinot Noir is light-bodied and has a fruit-forward flavor profile that should complement the rich, savory flavor of the braunschweiger.
3. Riesling: If you prefer white wine, a Riesling is a good option for pairing with braunschweiger. Look for a dry or off-dry Riesling to balance the richness of the meat.
4. Sparkling wine: If you want to add a bit of romance to your dinner, consider a sparkling wine. Prosecco or Cava are both affordable options that will add a celebratory touch to your meal.

When choosing a wine, keep in mind that personal taste plays a big role in pairing wine with food. If you have a preferred type of wine, go with that. The most important thing is that you enjoy the wine you choose!
